0: Story highlights Trump finished up his nine-day trip in Italy NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He spoke at US Naval Air Station Sigonella before leaving for Washington NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Naval Air Station Sigonella, Italy (CNN) President Donald Trump couldn't return home from his first foreign trip without taking a quick victory lap. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But even as he touted the successes of his nine-day sweep through the Middle East and Europe before boarding Air Force One, Trump appeared eager to delay his return to Washington, where a storm of controversy awaits him. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Maybe I'll stay down with you and celebrate together and just wave," Trump joked to the several hundred US service members and their families who crowded into an airplane hangar here to see him off. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Air Force One landed shortly after 9 p.m. ET Saturday at Joint Base Andrews outside Washington, and he and first lady Melania Trump left by helicopter for the White House. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Now that he's back in Washington, he will have to confront the latest developments in the federal investigation into members of his campaign's potential collusion with Russian officials during the 2016 election.
